analgesics.indication: Used to relieve pain and reduce fever.
analgesics.pharmacology: Acetaminophen works centrally in the brain to reduce pain and fever signals.
analgesics.contraindications: Avoid acetaminophen if you are allergic to it or if you have severe liver disease.
analgesics.composition: Available in various forms, including tablets, capsules, and liquid formulations.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include nausea and liver toxicity if taken in excess.
analgesics.interactions: Acetaminophen may interact with certain medications, including alcohol. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used to relieve pain, reduce inflammation, and lower fever.
analgesics.pharmacology: Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that reduces inflammation and pain by inhibiting enzymes.
analgesics.contraindications: Avoid ibuprofen if you are allergic to NSAIDs or have a history of gastrointestinal bleeding.
analgesics.composition: Available in tablet, capsule, and liquid forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include stomach upset and increased risk of bleeding.
analgesics.interactions: Ibuprofen may interact with certain medications, including blood thinners. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used to relieve pain, reduce inflammation, and lower fever.
analgesics.pharmacology: Naproxen is an NSAID that reduces inflammation and pain by inhibiting enzymes.
analgesics.contraindications: Avoid naproxen if you are allergic to NSAIDs or have a history of gastrointestinal bleeding.
analgesics.composition: Available in tablet and liquid forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include stomach upset and increased risk of bleeding.
analgesics.interactions: Naproxen may interact with certain medications, including blood thinners. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used to relieve pain, reduce inflammation, lower fever, and prevent heart attacks and strokes in certain individuals.
analgesics.pharmacology: Aspirin is an NSAID that reduces inflammation and pain by inhibiting enzymes. It also acts as an antiplatelet agent.
analgesics.contraindications: Avoid aspirin if you are allergic to NSAIDs or have a history of bleeding disorders.
analgesics.composition: Available in tablet and chewable tablet forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include stomach upset and increased risk of bleeding.
analgesics.interactions: Aspirin may interact with certain medications, including blood thinners. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used for the management of moderate to severe pain.
analgesics.pharmacology: Oxycodone is an opioid analgesic that binds to opioid receptors in the brain and spinal cord, reducing pain perception.
analgesics.contraindications: Avoid oxycodone if you have a history of opioid addiction or respiratory depression.
analgesics.composition: Available in tablet and extended-release tablet forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include drowsiness, constipation, and potential for opioid addiction.
analgesics.interactions: Oxycodone may interact with certain medications and alcohol. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used for the management of moderate to severe pain.
analgesics.pharmacology: Hydrocodone is an opioid analgesic that binds to opioid receptors in the brain and spinal cord, reducing pain perception.
analgesics.contraindications: Avoid hydrocodone if you have a history of opioid addiction or respiratory depression.
analgesics.composition: Available in tablet and liquid forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include drowsiness, constipation, and potential for opioid addiction.
analgesics.interactions: Hydrocodone may interact with certain medications and alcohol. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used for the relief of mild to moderately severe pain.

analgesics.contraindications: Avoid codeine if you have a history of opioid addiction or respiratory depression.

adverse_effects: Common side effects include drowsiness, constipation, and potential for opioid addiction.
analgesics.interactions: Codeine may interact with certain medications and alcohol. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used for the management of moderate to moderately severe pain.
analgesics.pharmacology: Tramadol is an opioid analgesic that binds to opioid receptors in the brain and spinal cord and also inhibits the reuptake of norepinephrine and serotonin.

adverse_effects: Common side effects include drowsiness, nausea, and potential for opioid addiction.
analgesics.interactions: Tramadol may interact with certain medications and alcohol. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used for the management of severe pain.

analgesics.contraindications: Avoid morphine if you have a history of opioid addiction or respiratory depression.

adverse_effects: Common side effects include drowsiness, constipation, and potential for opioid addiction.
analgesics.interactions: Morphine may interact with certain medications and alcohol. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used for the management of severe pain, especially in cases of chronic pain or post-surgery pain.

analgesics.interactions: Fentanyl may interact with certain medications and alcohol. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.interactions: Pregabalin may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used to relieve pain and reduce inflammation in conditions like osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
analgesics.pharmacology: Diclofenac is an NSAID that reduces inflammation and pain by inhibiting enzymes.
analgesics.contraindications: Avoid diclofenac if you are allergic to NSAIDs or have a history of gastrointestinal bleeding.

adverse_effects: Common side effects include stomach upset and increased risk of bleeding.
analgesics.interactions: Diclofenac may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used for the management of moderate to severe pain.

analgesics.interactions: Hydromorphone may interact with certain medications and alcohol. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used for the management of severe pain and as part of opioid addiction treatment programs.
analgesics.pharmacology: Methadone is a synthetic opioid analgesic that binds to opioid receptors in the brain and spinal cord, reducing pain perception.
analgesics.contraindications: Avoid methadone if you have a history of opioid addiction or respiratory depression.
analgesics.composition: Available in tablet, liquid, and injection forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include drowsiness, constipation, and potential for opioid addiction.
analgesics.interactions: Methadone may interact with certain medications and alcohol. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used for short-term relief of moderate to severe pain, typically in a hospital setting.
analgesics.pharmacology: Ketorolac is an NSAID that reduces inflammation and pain by inhibiting enzymes.
analgesics.contraindications: Avoid ketorolac if you are allergic to NSAIDs or have a history of gastrointestinal bleeding.
analgesics.composition: Available in tablet, injection, and nasal spray forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include stomach upset and increased risk of bleeding.
analgesics.interactions: Ketorolac may interact with certain medications, including blood thinners. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used to rapidly reverse opioid overdose and restore normal respiration.
analgesics.pharmacology: Naloxone competitively binds to opioid receptors, reversing the effects of opioid toxicity.
analgesics.contraindications: Naloxone is used in emergency situations to treat opioid overdose and is not typically contraindicated.
analgesics.composition: Available in injection and nasal spray forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include rapid withdrawal symptoms in opioid-dependent individuals.
analgesics.interactions: Naloxone may interact with opioids and may precipitate opioid withdrawal. It is administered in emergency situations as needed.

analgesics.indication: Used for the management of moderate to severe pain.
analgesics.pharmacology: Meperidine is an opioid analgesic that binds to opioid receptors in the brain and spinal cord, reducing pain perception.
analgesics.contraindications: Avoid meperidine if you have a history of opioid addiction or respiratory depression.

analgesics.interactions: Meperidine may interact with certain medications and alcohol. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

analgesics.indication: Used to provide local anesthesia and relieve pain during medical procedures.

analgesics.composition: Available in various forms, including creams, gels, and injectable solutions.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include local skin reactions and, in rare cases, systemic toxicity.
analgesics.interactions: Lidocaine may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antibiotics.indication: Used to treat a wide range of bacterial infections.

antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and to improve survival after a heart attack.
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Lisinopril relaxes blood vessels by inhibiting the conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II, a potent vasoconstrictor.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid lisinopril if you have a history of angioedema or are pregnant.
antihypertensives.composition: Available in tablet and oral solution forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include cough, dizziness, and elevated blood potassium levels.
antihypertensives.interactions: Lisinopril may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure and angina (chest pain).
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Amlodipine relaxes blood vessels by inhibiting calcium influx into smooth muscle cells.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid amlodipine if you have a history of severe liver disease.
antihypertensives.composition: Available in tablet and oral solution forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include peripheral edema (swelling of the legs), dizziness, and flushing.
antihypertensives.interactions: Amlodipine may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure, angina, and prevent migraines.
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Metoprolol reduces heart rate and blood pressure by blocking beta-adrenergic receptors.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid metoprolol if you have certain heart conditions or severe bradycardia (slow heart rate).
antihypertensives.composition: Available in tablet and injection forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include fatigue, dizziness, and cold extremities.
antihypertensives.interactions: Metoprolol may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure and reduce fluid retention (edema).
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Hydrochlorothiazide promotes diuresis by increasing the excretion of sodium and water in the kidneys.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid hydrochlorothiazide if you have severe kidney dysfunction or electrolyte imbalances.
antihypertensives.composition: Available in tablet and capsule forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include electrolyte imbalances, increased urination, and dizziness.
antihypertensives.interactions: Hydrochlorothiazide may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure and protect the kidneys in diabetic patients.
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Losartan blocks the action of angiotensin II, a hormone that narrows blood vessels.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid losartan if you are pregnant or have severe liver disease.
antihypertensives.composition: Available in tablet and oral solution forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include dizziness, cough, and elevated blood potassium levels.
antihypertensives.interactions: Losartan may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and improve survival after a heart attack.
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Valsartan blocks the action of angiotensin II, a hormone that narrows blood vessels.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid valsartan if you are pregnant or have severe liver disease.
antihypertensives.composition: Available in tablet and oral solution forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include dizziness, headache, and elevated blood potassium levels.
antihypertensives.interactions: Valsartan may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure, angina, and prevent migraines.
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Atenolol reduces heart rate and blood pressure by blocking beta-adrenergic receptors.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid atenolol if you have certain heart conditions or severe bradycardia (slow heart rate).
adverse_effects: Common side effects include fatigue, dizziness, and cold extremities.
antihypertensives.interactions: Atenolol may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and improve survival after a heart attack.
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Ramipril relaxes blood vessels by inhibiting the conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II, a potent vasoconstrictor.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid ramipril if you have a history of angioedema or are pregnant.
antihypertensives.composition: Available in capsule and tablet forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include cough, dizziness, and elevated blood potassium levels.
antihypertensives.interactions: Ramipril may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antihypertensives.therapeutic_class: Thiazide Diuretic + Angiotensin II Receptor Blocker (ARB)
antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure and reduce fluid retention (edema).
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Hydrochlorothiazide promotes diuresis, and losartan blocks the action of angiotensin II.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid HCTZ/losartan if you have severe kidney dysfunction or electrolyte imbalances.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include electrolyte imbalances, increased urination, dizziness, and cough.
antihypertensives.interactions: HCTZ/losartan may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and reduce the risk of heart-related death.
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Carvedilol blocks beta-adrenergic and alpha-1 receptors, reducing heart rate and relaxing blood vessels.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid carvedilol if you have severe bradycardia, certain heart conditions, or severe liver disease.
antihypertensives.composition: Available in tablet and capsule forms.
adverse_effects: Common side effects include fatigue, dizziness, and fluid retention.
antihypertensives.interactions: Carvedilol may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider about potential drug interactions.

antihypertensives.indication: Used to treat high blood pressure and angina (chest pain).
antihypertensives.pharmacology: Nifedipine relaxes blood vessels by inhibiting calcium influx into smooth muscle cells.
antihypertensives.contraindications: Avoid nifedipine if you have certain heart conditions or severe hypotension (low blood pressure).
antihypertensives.composition: Available in capsule and tablet forms.

antimalarials.indication: Used to treat and prevent malaria caused by Plasmodium species.
antimalarials.pharmacology: Chloroquine interferes with the parasite's ability to digest and utilize hemoglobin.
antimalarials.contraindications: Avoid chloroquine if you have a history of retinal or vision problems.

antimalarials.indication: Used to treat and prevent malaria caused by Plasmodium species, especially in areas with resistance to other drugs.
antimalarials.pharmacology: Mefloquine interferes with the parasite's ability to digest and utilize hemoglobin.
antimalarials.contraindications: Avoid mefloquine if you have a history of seizures or certain psychiatric conditions.

antimalarials.indication: Used to treat and prevent malaria caused by Plasmodium species.
antimalarials.pharmacology: Atovaquone disrupts the parasite's mitochondrial function, and proguanil inhibits the parasite's DNA synthesis.
